title: Use smallest available kafka offset when a new partition is detected
body:
When a new partition is detected, the code currently uses the table configuration to decide the offset to seek to. This change updates it to seek to the smallest offset - the rationale is that we would like the partitions to have as much data as possible to serve requests effectively. (This would mostly impact tables that have the offset set to 'largest').

Changes include tests to ensure that the right offset is sought when new tables are created and when new partitions are added.

title: Add query option 'attachValueInForColumns' to automatically attach VALUE_IN UDF to MV group-by columns
body:
Also keep the order of values in IN clause while performing the deduplication, to make the attached UDF deterministic
Added tests in RequestPreprocessUtilsTest and OfflineClusterIntegrationTest

E.g.
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM table WHERE column1 IN (1, 2, 3) AND column2 IN ('a', 'b', 'c') GROUP BY column1, column2 OPTION(attachValueInForColumns='column1, column2')
->
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM table WHERE column1 IN (1, 2, 3) AND column2 IN ('a', 'b', 'c') GROUP BY ValueIn(column1, 1, 2, 3), ValueIn(column2, 'a', 'b', 'c')

title: [TE] RCA Advanced Dimension Analysis - Service and Component
body:
This PR is mainly setting up the data flow for Advanced Dimension Analysis table in RCA and includes:
- Ember data wiring: model/adapter/serializer for `dimensions`
- Query caching service for dimensions
- Component for `rootcause-dimensions` (parses data from several RCA objects, including `context` as the user changes the selected metric or analysis window)
- Removing call to `services/all`, which is not needed in `entity-mapping-modal`

Testing:
- Added initial integration test for dimensions component. Skipping for now until I can work out why its not getting mirage data.

427 assertions of 427 passed, 0 failed.

title: Add support for config profiles
body:
Add support for configuration profiles, which allow configurations to
have values based on which profiles are enabled. For example, one might
have profiles for us-west, us-east, and asia-south, with different
settings:

replication_us-west=6
replication_us-east=6
replication_asia-south=3

Since more than one profile can be enabled at a time, it is also
possible to do:

replication_us=6
replication_asia-south=3

Add support for deserialization hooks, so that values that require
special support (eg. field size) can be properly filled in.

Sort FieldSpecs by name and make schema comparison independent of the
fieldspec order.

title: Fixed NPE bug for PartitionAwareOfflineRoutingTableBuilder
body:
PartitionAwareOfflineRoutingTableBuilder was caching the number of replicas
from the table config during the initialization and never updates the value
even if there was a change. This caused NPE when the broker attempts to compute
routing table after servers were added to table and rebalance was invoked.
This PR addresses this bug and also added the unit test to make sure the fix
resolves the issue.

title: Avoid catching broad 'Exception' and prefer throwing a more specific runtime exception
body:
Currently, the code throws runtime exceptions for indicate incorrect input to the method - this forces users of the method to also catch broader category of exceptions to handle the case of invalid input (invalid input may not always be a showstopper; for ex, the users might be able to use a default value instead if the configured value is not parseable). Ideally, a checked exception would have been better, but I didn't want to make method signature changes as all callers have to be updated and some of them could be beyond this package.

- Updated javadocs to reflect method behavior.
- Unit test validates that IllegalArgumentException is indeed thrown when the input is incorrect.

title: Segment size based flush threshold update
body:
Adding a segment size based flush threshold updater which updates the flush threshold rows of the new segment metadata, based on the segment size and number of rows of previous segment
The formula used to compute new number of rows is:
  `targetNumRows = ideal_segment_size * ( a * current_rows_to_size_ratio + b * previous_rows_to_size_ratio)`
  where a = 0.25, b = 0.75
  This ensures that we take into account the history of the segment size and number rows

title: Prevent Realtime table creation if schema is missing
body:
Currently, a realtime table can be added without a schema. The missing schema is detected on the server when a offline->consuming transition is attempted. This change ensures the controller returns a 400 error when a realtime table is created without schema.

Changes include:
- unit tests to test the realtime table creation fails if there is no schema
- new method in base ControllerTest to add a default schema to use with realtime tables.

title: Prevent Realtime table creation if schema is missing
body:
Currently, a realtime table can be added without a schema. The missing schema is detected on the server when a offline->consuming transition is attempted. This change ensures the controller returns a 400 error when a realtime table is created without schema.

The change was tested manually, where a schema was deleted via zooinspector just before the add call is made. Verified that 400 is returned in this case.

repo.name: pinot
repo.description: Apache Pinot - A realtime distributed OLAP datastore

title: TDigest Support: Support for TDigest based percentile estimation.
body:
This PR has two parts, first part is to support byte[] as native data type in Pinot which is required to store the TDigest bytes. The second part provides the actual support for TDigest based percentile aggregation functions.

Byte Array Support:
1. Segment generator can now consume (Bytes) byte[] data type from
input, and index it appropriately:
   - For fixed length columns: Sorted, unsorted, and no-dictionary
     indexing is supported.
   - For variable length columns: Only no-dictionary indexing is
     supported. This is because current dictionary based indexing would
required padding variable length values to make them fixed length, which
is not feasible for byte[].
   - Only Single-Valued columns currently supported.
   - TODO: Add support for Multi-valued columns of byte[] type.

2. Segments containing columns with Bytes data type can now be loaded
and read in.

3. Mutable & Immutable off-heap as well as on-heap dictionaries now supported for
byte[].

TDigest Support:
1. Added support for aggregation and selection operators.
    - TDigest columns can now be aggregated.
    - Selection returns Hex String equivalent of the bytes.

2. Added new percentileTDigest aggregation functions to support TDigest based percentiles.
    - percentileTDigest for MV columns is not supported yet.

Added unit test for all the new functionality.

title: [TE] onboarding - classic task execution
body:
The existing self-serve implementation uses a reverse proxy to a backend node as a backstop solution. This PR removes the reverse proxy and consolidates replay execution state in the database 

* move task creation for replay into webapp

* wrap onboarding framework execution in classic TE task

* eliminate reverse proxy for self-serve

title: [TE] rootcause - reload filters before adding metric to chart
body: The "auto-add on select" feature created a regression where a newly selected metric would apply stale pre-selected filters even though the new metric does not support the filter dimension. This PR forces re-fetching and pruning of filters when a new metric is selected.

title: [TE] dataframe - lazy timestamps
body: The existing dataframe util eagerly generates timestamp in dataset-granularity resolution. This is not scalable to second or millisecond resolution data. This PR eschews eager timestamp generation for a lazy approach.
